channel.title: Deepak Guneja website
channel.description: Recent content on Deepak Guneja website

item.title: Let's see the trend youth is following!
item.description: Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Every two years, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention conduct the Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance System (YRBSS) survey, where it takes data from high schoolers (9th through 12th grade), to analyze health patterns. We selected group of variables from a random sample of observations during one of the years the YRBSS was conducted. Load the data data(yrbss) glimpse(yrbss) ## Rows: 13,583 ## Columns: 13 ## $ age <int> 14, 14, 15, 15, 15, 15, 15, 14, 15, 15, 15.

item.title: Let's study Yield Curves if they can predict Recessions!
item.description: Yield Curve inversion In our case we will look at US data and use the FRED database to download historical yield curve rates, and plot the yield curves since 1999 to see when the yield curves flatten. First, we will use the tidyquant package to download monthly rates for different durations. # Get a list of FRED codes for US rates and US yield curve; choose monthly frequency # to see, eg.

item.title: Let's use use Gapminder data to find interesting facts..
item.description: Gapminder # load gapminder HIV data adults_with_hiv_percent_age_15_49 <- read_csv(here::here("data","adults_with_hiv_percent_age_15_49.csv")) life_expectancy_years <- read_csv(here::here("data","life_expectancy_years.csv")) # get World bank data using wbstats indicators <- c("SP.DYN.TFRT.IN","SE.PRM.NENR", "SH.DYN.MORT", "NY.GDP.PCAP.KD") library(wbstats) worldbank_data <- wb_data(country="countries_only", #countries only- no aggregates like Latin America, Europe, etc. indicator = indicators, start_date = 1960, end_date = 2016) # get a dataframe of information regarding countries, indicators, sources, regions, indicator topics, lending types, income levels, from the World Bank API countries <- wbstats::wb_cachelist$countries Relationship between HIV prevalence and life expectancy.

item.title: Movie buff?? You'll find this interesting!
item.description: Analysis of movies- IMDB dataset movies <- read_csv(here::here("data", "movies.csv")) glimpse(movies) ## Rows: 2,961 ## Columns: 11 ## $ title <chr> "Avatar", "Titanic", "Jurassic World", "The Ave... ## $ genre <chr> "Action", "Drama", "Action", "Action", "Action"... ## $ director <chr> "James Cameron", "James Cameron", "Colin Trevor... ## $ year <dbl> 2009, 1997, 2015, 2012, 2008, 1999, 1977, 2015,... ## $ duration <dbl> 178, 194, 124, 173, 152, 136, 125, 141, 164, 93.

item.title: My biography
item.description: Biography My name is Deepak Guneja, and I am reading Masters in Financial Analysis degree at the London Business School. I am a major in Computer Science with a minor in Finance from BITS-Pilani, India. I have been fortunate enough to receive Merit Scholarships from both LBS and BITS. I am an avid learner, a great teamplayer, and a focused individual. Coming from a Computer Science background, I can comfortably code in multiple programming languages:

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
